property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Infinite Frontiers

property.name: Rules
property.value: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Engineered for Success

property.name: Rules
property.value: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Once and Future Android.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Guarding the Net

property.name: Rules
property.value: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: Install up to three targeted ICE from hand||Refill hand to 5

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs. Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [Click] [Click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" - Director Haas

property.name: Rules
property.value: Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card. [Click], [Trash]: Gain 2 [Credits] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced. If you pay 3 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.

property.name: Rules
property.value: You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn. If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [Click], hosted advancement token: Gain [Click] [Click], Use this ability only once per turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Thomas Haas can be advanced. [Trash]: Gain 2 [Credits] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite passtime appears to be disappointing his mother.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn. Gain 7 [Credits].

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0. [Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The realm beyond is still forbidden.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.||[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.||[Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." - g00ru

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The game has changed.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] Trash target program.||[Subroutine] Trace 3. If successful give the Runner 1 Tag and inflict 1 brain damage.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as teh outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sometimes you just have to guess.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Bioroid-Tracer-AP

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break u to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] Trace 2 – If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0.||[Subroutine] End the run.||Remove a power counter to inflict 1 Brain Damage

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0. [Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A mind of meat! How does it work?

property.name: Rules
property.value: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece of ice installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7 [Credits], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.

property.name: Rules
property.value: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server you may rez Tyr's Hand. [Trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click], [Click]: Gain 3 [Credits].

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? - the New Gospel of Wealth

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click], 1 [Credits]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." - g00ru

property.name: Rules
property.value: Gain 2 [Credits] when your turn begins. Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There's only about a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] End the Run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of a connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] The Runner must pay 2 [Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2 [Credits], end the run. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Cheap off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] Force the runner to lose exactly 2 [Credits] or end the run||[Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Rules
property.value: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Keeper of Knowledge

property.name: Rules
property.value: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "New technology destroys the old."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I can make that work."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing that ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2 [Credits] for each program trashed.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." - Matt "The Mere" Thomas

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this card, trash an installed program. Install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: One man's trash.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're head of it, that is.

property.name: Rules
property.value: +3 [Memory Units] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4 [Credits] Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 3 [Credits]: Prevent 1 net damage. [Trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It still hurts a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 3 [Credits]: Prevent 1 net damage.||[Trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It is good practice to backup the backup.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Omni-drive can host a single program of 1 [Memory Unit] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. 1 [Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you install Atman, you may pay X [Credits] to place X power counters on Atman. Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1 [Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall..."

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1 [Credits]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "... and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." - revenant.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.||1 [Credits]: +5 strength. Must have credits on a stealth card.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana. If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1 [Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can be used only during a run on the chosen server.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2 [Recurring Credits] Use these credits to trash assets.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Perfect for flooding servers.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2 [Credits], [Trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your deck.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left by rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had be replaced with cat vids." - The Professor

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2 [Recurring Credits] Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2 [Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Hanan Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Hanan Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." - The Professor

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credit]: Break a barrier subroutine.||2 [Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Gain 1 [Credits] and draw 1 card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.

property.name: Rules
property.value: +1 [Link] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1 [Credits] on Ice Analyzer. You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." - Exile

property.name: Rules
property.value: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5 [Credits] if it was successful.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner...

property.name: Rules
property.value: Place 8 [Credits] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it. Take 2 [Credits] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We say 'cyber-terrorist'; they hear 'underground celebrity.'" - Michael Muhama, professional expert

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click], [Click], [Trash]: Play an event card from your heap (paying its play cost).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.

property.name: Rules
property.value: The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1. As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3 [Credits]. Trash The Source when an agenda is stolen or scored.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
